official-title.#text:
To improve efficiency by consolidating some duplicative
		  and overlapping Government programs.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text:
Committee on Oversight and Government
			 Reform

committee-name.#tail:
, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Improving All Government Efficiency
			 Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Consolidating
			 unnecessary duplicative and overlapping Government programs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall coordinate with the heads of the relevant departments or agencies
			 to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, the

use available
			 administrative authority to eliminate, consolidate, or streamline Government
			 programs and agencies with duplicative and overlapping missions identified
			 in—

quote.#text:
Actions
			 Needed to Reduce Fragmentation, Overlap, and Duplication and Achieve Other
			 Financial Benefits

text.#text:
the April 2013
			 Government Accountability Office report to Congress, entitled

quote.#text:
Opportunities to Reduce Duplication, Overlap and Fragmentation, Achieve
			 Savings, and Enhance Revenue

text.#text:
the February 2012
			 Government Accountability Office report to Congress, entitled

quote.#tail: (GAO–11–318SP) and apply the savings towards deficit reduction;
quote.#text: Opportunities to Reduce Potential Duplication in Government Programs, Save Tax Dollars, and Enhance Revenue
